# Packages

Load packages
```{r Load packages}
library(knitr)
library(summarytools)
library(psych)
library(foreign) # Needed to load spss data files
library(tidyverse)
```

Source the data file path
```{r source data file path}
#source raw data directory: data_raw and data included
source("../../../../isolation_trajectories_data_path.R")
```

# Read in data
Read in full spss file
```{r read in data (spss)}
dat <- read.spss(file = paste0(data.raw_path, "Katie_18Dec20.sav"),
                  use.value.labels = FALSE, #convert value labels into factors with those labels
                  to.data.frame = TRUE) #return data frame 

colnames(dat)
```

# Item lists
Only using elder twin variables as each twin is included in the data set as an individual. Without doing twin analyses, the elder and younger variables show the same information. 
```{r prepare item lists}
#All the items in numeric form
all_social_isolation <- c("sisoe5",
                          "sisoet5",
                          "sisoem5",
                          "sisoe7",
                          "sisoet7",
                          "sisoem7",
                          "sisoe10",
                          "sisoet10",
                          "sisoem10",
                          "sisoe12",
                          "sisoet12",
                          "sisoem12")

social_isoaltion_5 <- c("sisoe5",
                          "sisoet5",
                          "sisoem5")

social_isoaltion_7 <- c("sisoe7",
                          "sisoet7",
                          "sisoem7")

social_isoaltion_10 <- c("sisoe10",
                          "sisoet10",
                          "sisoem10")

social_isoaltion_12 <- c("sisoe12",
                          "sisoet12",
                          "sisoem12")

combined_social_isolation <- c("sisoe5",
                              "sisoe7",
                              "sisoe10",
                              "sisoe12")

teacher_social_isolation <- c("sisoet5",
                              "sisoet7",
                              "sisoet10",
                              "sisoet12")

mother_social_isolation <- c("sisoem5",
                              "sisoem7",
                              "sisoem10",
                              "sisoem12")
```

#Rename ID variable
When doing non-twin analyses - the atwin and btwin id give the same information
```{r rename ID}
dat <- dat %>%
  mutate(
    id = atwinid
  )

dat <- dat %>%
  mutate(
    randomised_order = rorderp5
  )
#check
colnames(dat)
```


# Missing values
Make sue that any values coded as -9, -999 , -8, -7 or -1 are coded as NA
```{r recode missing values}
# Recode missing values to NAs in numeric variables
dat <- dat %>%
  mutate_if(is.numeric, ~na_if(., -9)) %>% # missing
  mutate_if(is.numeric, ~na_if(., -999)) %>% # missing
  mutate_if(is.numeric, ~na_if(., -1))  %>% # no question
  mutate_if(is.numeric, ~na_if(., -8))  %>% # missing specific to the question
  mutate_if(is.numeric, ~na_if(., -7)) # missing specific to the question
```

## Missingness for social isolation variables

```{r social isolation missingness}
# create the NA per person variable
dat <- dat %>%
  mutate(
    na.per.person.si =
      rowSums(
        is.na(dat[,colnames(dat) %in% combined_social_isolation])
      )
  )

#look at the frequency of this
freq(dat$na.per.person.si,
     cumul = FALSE)


#look at the frequency at 5 years only
freq(dat$sisoe5,
     cumul = FALSE)

#look at the frequency at 7 years only
freq(dat$sisoe7,
     cumul = FALSE)

#look at the frequency at 10 years only
freq(dat$sisoe10,
     cumul = FALSE)

#look at the frequency at 12 years only
freq(dat$sisoe12,
     cumul = FALSE)
```

```{r create variables for different group combinations}
# group with 18 missing 3 time points vs everyone else
dat <- dat %>%
  mutate(
    missing_3_time_points = 
      if_else(
        na.per.person.si > 2, 
        1,
        0) %>%
      recode_factor(
        "0" = "No",
        "1" = "Yes"
      )
  )

# create group of just 18 who have 3 missing time points
dat.18 <- filter(dat, missing_3_time_points == "Yes")

# excluding the 18 missing 3 time points, those with 2 missing time points vs every one else
dat.missing.3time <- filter(dat,
                      na.per.person.si != 3)

dat.missing.3time <- dat.missing.3time %>%
  mutate(
    missing_2_time_points = 
      if_else(
        na.per.person.si > 1 & na.per.person.si < 3, 
        1,
        0) %>%
      recode_factor(
        "0" = "No",
        "1" = "Yes"
      )
  )
```

What Tim found :
There were no differences between those who did and did not take part at age 18 in terms of social isolation at age 5 (t = 0.71, p = 0.49), socioeconomic status (SES) assessed when the cohort was initially defined (Ï‡2 = 0.86, p = 0.65), age-5 IQ scores (t = 0.98, p = 0.33), or age-5 emotional or behavioural problems (t = 0.40, p = 0.69 and t = 0.41, p = 0.68, respectively)
```{r check differences in missingness between the 4 groups}
# Social isolation at age 5
ttest_SI_3time <- t.test( 
  sisoe5 ~ missing_3_time_points,
  data = dat,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95)

ttest_SI_2time <- t.test( 
  sisoe5 ~ missing_2_time_points,
  data = dat.missing.3time,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

# SES - chi square
chisq_SES_3time <- chisq.test(dat$SES,dat$missing_3_time_points) # nonsig
chisq_SES_2time <- chisq.test(dat.missing.3time$SES, dat.missing.3time$missing_2_time_points) # nonsig

# IQ - t-test
ttest_IQ_3time <- t.test( #nonsig
  iqe5 ~ missing_3_time_points,
  data = dat,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

ttest_IQ_2time <- t.test( #SIGNIFICANT - missing two time points has lower IQ
  iqe5 ~ missing_2_time_points,
  data = dat.missing.3time,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

# Emotional problems - internalising??? - t-test
ttest_int_3time <- t.test( #nonsig
  intisoe5 ~ missing_3_time_points,
  data = dat,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

ttest_int_2time <- t.test( #nonsig
  intisoe5 ~ missing_2_time_points,
  data = dat.missing.3time,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

# Behavioural problems - externalising?? - t-test
ttest_ext_3time <- t.test( #nonsig
  totexte5 ~ missing_3_time_points,
  data = dat,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 

ttest_ext_2time <- t.test( #nonsig
  totexte5 ~ missing_2_time_points,
  data = dat.missing.3time,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  conf.level = 0.95) 
```

```{r rename social isolation variables for 3 missing dataset}
    ## Age 18
    # Mental health and service use
    depression_diagnosis_12mo_18,

    anxiety_diagnosis_18,
    anxiety_current_scale_18 = gadsxe18, #which scale is this?
    ADHD_diagnosis_18,
    inattentive_hyperactive_symptoms_total_18 = SR_symtot18e,
    conduct_disorder_moderate_18, # is this a diagnosis?
    conduct_disorder_symptoms_18 = cdsxe18,
    alcohol_dependence_18,
    alcohol_abuse_18,
    alcohol_symptom_scale_18 = alcsxe18,
    cannabis_dependence_18,
    cannabis_symptom_scale_18 = marjsxe18,
    PTSD_diagnosis_lifetime_18,
    PTSD_diagnosis_current_18,
    psychosis_symptom_count_18 = psysympe18,
    cat_psychosis_symptom_count_18,
    psychosis_experiences_scale_18 = psyexpe18,
    cat_psychosis_experiences_scale_18,
    suicide_attempt_selfharm_18,

    BMI_18 = bmie18,
    CRP_log_18 = lnCRP_E18_4SD,
    physical_activity_18 = phyacte18,

    # Coping and functioning
    loneliness_18 = lonelye18,
    life_satisfaction_18 = lifsate18,
    technology_use_18 = teche18,
    coping_with_stress_18 = copstrse18,
    PSQI_global_score_18 = psqie18,
    #Employment prospects
    not_in_employment_education_18,

    ## Social isolation
    isolation_combined_05 = sisoe5, # only ELDER variables included here - need to add a chunk to select younger variables if decide to do twin analyses. 
    isolation_combined_07 = sisoe7,
    isolation_combined_10 = sisoe10,
    isolation_combined_12 = sisoe12,
    isolation_mother_05 = sisoem5,
```

```{r rename social isolation variables for full dataset}
  )
# check
colnames(dat.renamed.full)
```

# Select variables to be exported into rds and csv files 
Have hashed out the trajectory file - as each time you need to manually edit the NAs and header for Mplus. So just use this one export and no need to run the whole chunk again. 

	
```{r selct variables to export files}
#select variables for rds file
dat_rds.3missing <- dat.renamed.3missing 
dat_rds.full <- dat.renamed.full

#select variables for csv file (for Mplus) - uses numeric values rather than factors
dat_csv.3missing <- dat.3missing %>%
  select(
    id, 
    familyid, 
    rorderp5, 
    torder, 
    risks,
    cohort,
    sampsex,
    zygosity,
    seswq35,
    sisoe5,
    sisoe7,
    sisoe10,
    sisoe12,
    log_5 = log_sisoe5,
    log_7 = log_sisoe7,
    log_10 = log_sisoe10,
    log_12 = log_sisoe12)

#select variables for csv file (for Mplus) - uses numeric values rather than factors
dat_csv.full <- dat %>%
  select(
    id, 
    familyid, 
    rorderp5, 
    torder, 
    risks,
    cohort,
    sampsex,
    zygosity,
    seswq35,
    sisoe5,
    sisoe7,
    sisoe10,
    sisoe12,
    log_5 = log_sisoe5,
    log_7 = log_sisoe7,
    log_10 = log_sisoe10,
    log_12 = log_sisoe12)
```

Export the data as rds and csv (for Mplus) files 
```{r export new data files}
# save R data file
saveRDS(object = dat_rds.3missing, file = paste0(data_path, "preprocessed_isolation_trajectories_Jan2021_3missing.rds"))
saveRDS(object = dat_rds.full, file = paste0(data_path, "preprocessed_isolation_trajectories_Jan2021_full_sample.rds"))
```
